Description: Lower body fragment of North Ionian Late Wild Goat pottery oinochoe; interior reserved; exterior, brown-cream slip: wild goat to right, head turned back; filling ornaments: rosettes, cross with dots, strokes and roundel; purple patches on neck and shoulder of wild goat; below, two broad bands with added white and red stripes frame a frieze of hook meanders.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Published in CVA Oxford 2, II D, p. 79, no. 14 (wrongly numbered G125.68), pl. IV.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (IId pl. 4, 14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.607)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.668, table 8.8) (no.13 or 14?)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
